channel.title: linux on A Developer's Note
channel.description: Recent content in linux on A Developer's Note

item.title: How to fix Could Not Resolve Hostname github.com on Linux
item.description: This situation began when I planned to do a git pull on a project in CentOS 7 server. However, unlike my previous experience, the response that appeared was as follows: 1 2 3 ssh: Could not resolve hostname github.com: Temporary failure in name resolution fatal: Could not read from remote repository. Please make sure you have the correct access rights and the repository exists. It was very surprising, because previously I could always do the pull without any problems.
